summary: Tesla’s strongest bulls believe the company's financials will get a massive boost as it makes progress with robotaxis and humanoid robots . Tesla generated 72% of its revenue in the first quarter (ended March 31) from the sale of its products .  Tesla is known for offering some of the most in-demand, tech-advanced, and well-designed EVs on the market . However, visionary founder and CEO Elon Musk believes Tesla's future will look different . There are two important projects that could, in theory, change the financial picture .  After years of strong double-digit revenue growth, Tesla's top line dipped 9% in the first quarter . Demand is under pressure, which has been due to higher interest rates . The industry has also now become much more competitive, as the cost of financing is more prohibitive .  It's so difficult to predict what Tesla will look like 10 or 20 years from now . Bullish investors appreciate the upside potential from FSD tech and humanoid robots . However, it's anyone's guess when, or if, this will become a reality on a global scale .  Tesla has probably minted some millionaires thanks to the stock's incredible ride higher in the past . But I'm not ready to say that the company will set new shareholders up for life . It's extremely rare to find a single company that can achieve this for your portfolio .  There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Buying Tesla stock today could set you up for life, says Motley Fool .

President Donald Trump's new bill seeks to eliminate tax incentives for electric vehicles . Tesla's capital advantage keeps the business safe for now . But eliminating EV tax credits could have a surprising effect on competition .  Analysts expect the company to refresh its existing lineup, but details are scarce on releasing any brand new models in 2025 or 2026 . Even if a new model is released, it's unlikely that production will scale meaningfully over the next 12 to 24 months . Any potential demand boost from releasing a more affordable Model Y or Model 3 could be offset by eliminated tax credits .  Tesla has $16 billion in cash and equivalents on the books, more than every other competitor . Its profit margins are positive -- a rarity in the EV world -- meaning it can afford to cut profits a bit without going into the red . Tesla's biggest advantage is its $1 trillion market cap .  The elimination of EV tax credits could be a secret win for Tesla . Most of its EV competition comes from unprofitable companies with minimal room for error like RivianandLucid Group . ExxonMobil wishes for a carbon tax to be implemented . A carbon tax would make its output more expensive to buyers .  The EV tax credit may end up in place until 2032 like previously planned . The elimination of these subsidies certainly won't "kill" Tesla . There's an argument that it could be a long-term advantage due to lessened competition .  Right now, we’re issuing ‘Double Down’ alerts for three incredible companies . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon .

Federal tax credits for electric vehicles could soon be eliminated . More than 90% of Tesla's sales come from just two models: The Model X .  Last quarter, Tesla posted a $409 million net profit, partially realized by $595 million in automotive regulatory credits . The fate of these credits is very unclear right now, but their elimination would likely further dampen Tesla's sales growth .  Tesla will lose a critical revenue source with nearly 100% profit margins . With EV deliveries already declining, the loss of federal EV tax credits or regulatory credits could put Tesla in an even more precarious position . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late .  Every Tesla investor should keep an eye on these two numbers . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Tesla is one of the top three companies in the U.S. market .

Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) is the world’s largest pure-play electric vehicle manufacturer . Jim Cramer has been a believer of the firm most of the time . However, after frictions between Elon Musk and President Trump last week, Cramer took a cautious stance and wondered if holding on to Tesla was worth it . We recently published a list ofJim Cramer Discusses Quantum Computing Stocks Among These 12 Stocks .  AI stock is also a major beneficiary of Trump tariffs and onshoring, see our free report on the best short-term AI stock .

Tesla's stock is down over 20% this year, and last quarter, it reported its biggest-ever drop in deliveries alongside itsweakest profitin four years . Tesla is still the top EV seller in the US, for now, but it’s facing threats on multiple fronts .  A third of Americans had afavorable views of Musk in April, a 9% drop from December . 65% of Americans said the billionaire CEO had too much influence on the federal government .  Since 2020, Tesla has launched only the Cybertruck, which hasn’t become the top-seller that Musk promised . Tesla sold 40,000 Cybertrucks last year, a far cry from its goal of 250,000 . Analyst says Tesla needs to introduce an affordable, mass-market car that can compete with a Honda Civic or Toyota Corolla .  The Model Y is Tesla’s top seller and was the best-selling EV overall in the US last year . A down-market model “could be their biggest mass market seller” and “outsell the Model Y,” Moloughney said .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk plans to launch robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, as soon as next Sunday . Musk has been promising that fully autonomous Teslas would arrive within a year every year since 2016 .  Tesla has a market value of about $1 trillion, more than 20 times that of GM . Musk has said investors that don’t believe Tesla will solve autonomous driving should sell their Tesla stock .  The company’s success or failure at the next bend in the road could determine its future . Elon Musk's focus is breaking into the auto industry to become an electric-vehicle leader .

Tesla shares are off by 8% (and a lot more) in June versus a 2% gain for the S&P 500 . Investors fear Trump will take aim at Musk's various lines of business . The president isn't one to forget digs, ever .  Tesla's stock is up 12% since October 2022, but consensus EPS estimates for 2025, 2026, and 2027 have since plunged 77%, 70%, and 71%, respectively . The stock is valued at a significant premium to the broader market despite EV tax credit extension .  Tesla's forward price-to-earnings multiple stands at an eye-popping 166 times compared to 22 times for the S&P 500 . Tesla is heading into at least two years of heavy investment to support robot building and robotaxi operations .  The stock has to correct for these elements to the story, says Brinkman . The past few years, it has morphed into more of a CEO and sports celeb scene, making it fertile ground to get clues on the economy .  Invest 2025 is Yahoo Finance's annual Invest conference in November . New this year is an exclusive dinner the day before the conference for investors, followed by two investor education rooms .

Tesla and BYD are two of the largest players in the electric vehicle space . BYD has outperformed Tesla in China lately . Investors seem more interested in Tesla's future initiatives than its EV business .  Tesla reported 337,000 vehicle deliveries in the first quarter of 2025, the lowest amount seen in over two years . Elon Musk's brand has seemingly alienated many, including current and potential Tesla customers . Increased competition in the EV space also seems to be taking market share from Tesla .  The bulls are banking on future initiatives such as Tesla's robotaxi service and the humanoid Optimus robots to hold the valuation up . Tesla recently began rolling out its first self-driving robotaxis in Austin, Texas, in a highly anticipated event .  BYD captured over 30% of the EV market in China, compared to Tesla's 6% . The company is reportedly building cheaper EVs that work better and have better charging capabilities than Tesla . Analysts expect BYD to grow earnings in 2025 by nearly 24% .  BYD trades at 25 times earnings, compared to Tesla at 179 . BYD may not have the same upside as a company like Tesla because the company isn't planning on rolling out robots or FSD technology . However, BYD is demonstrating strong growth and its core products are outperforming . Ben Kallo of Robert W. Baird downgraded Tesla from Buy to Hold mainly on valuation concerns . Kallo cited two key areas of concern behind the downgrade . He flagged elevated market expectations ahead of Tesla’s upcoming robotaxi event .  Tesla Inc. is an EV manufacturer and clean energy company known for its innovative approach to sustainable transportation and energy solutions . While we acknowledge the potential of TSLA as an investment, we believe certain AI stocks offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk .  Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend could be a problem for the U.S. significantly from Trump's trade policies . See our free report on the best short-term AI stock .

China granted rare earth export licenses to GM, Ford, and Stellantis (NYSE:STLA) but not to Tesla . China controls nearly 100% of global supply for the seven most critical heavy rare earth elements . U.S. auto sector is the largest end-user of these materials, but America’s consumption is a fraction of global output .  Wells Fargo warns the current arrangement is “still a band-aid, not a fix,” with supply risks likely to persist for another two to five years as new capacity ramps up outside China . For now, China’s selectivity in granting licenses and vigilance over end-use means Tesla could face mounting pressure .

Baird downgraded Tesla to Neutral with a $320 price target . Baird views Tesla as a core long-term play, but is wary of unanswered questions around the robotaxi rollout .  McDonald’s US operations, accounting for 40% of system sales, remain a cornerstone of its financial performance and sentiment . Recently, traffic declines among lower- and middle-income consumers have led to underperformance .  McDonald’s ambitious goal to expand from 40,000 to 50,000 global units by 2027, marking the fastest pace in its history . Chipotle has achieved a more balanced mix of traffic and check growth, highlighting a potential area of vulnerability for McDonald's .  Jefferies upgrades First Solar (FSLR) shares to Buy with a $192 price target . FSLR’s U.S.-made products stand to gain uniquely from stringent Chinese-import restrictions, likely to endure through Senate debates . The IRA's impact on utility-scale solar remains manageable, says Jefferies .  Jefferies raises the price target to $192, reflecting FSLR’s position as the sole large-scale U.S. domestic module manufacturer . Jefferies sees only a 20% decline in 2027/2028, with FSLr capturing no more than two-thirds of the market . Valuation is compelling: FSLRs trades at 7.5x 2026 P/E and 5.6x EV/E, a sharp discount to peers .  The bank’s revision stems from its assessment that CAG faces headwinds in the packaged food sector . Elevated inflation pressures in its protein-heavy cost of goods sold, coupled with diminished pricing power in its core single-serve frozen meals category, create challenges .  Wells Fargo upgraded Zscaler to Overweight with a $385 price target . Analyst sees FY25 unscheduled billings surge as catalyst for 20%+ growth by FY26 . $5B ARR target by FY27 achievable .  Wells Fargo sees room for further upside as revenue accelerates . Operating and free cash flow margins? Expanding . Zscaler’s path to $5B ARR isn’t just about top-line growth .

Fighting between Iran and Israel intensified over the weekend, with people dying in both countries and Iran reportedly pulling out of planned talks with the U.S. The Fed will hand down another decision on interest rates this week, with a decision scheduled for Wednesday . The coming weekend could see Tesla providing a significant update on the direction of the electric vehicle maker .  Tuesday's U.S. retail sales will make it clear whether strongspending levels continued . Housing construction data will provide insight into whether builders are catching up with lagging inventory levels . The pressure is on the Federal Reserve after May inflation data came in lower than economists expected .  The CME FedWatch Tool, which measures fed funds futures to determine the path of interest rates, indicates that traders overwhelmingly believe that Fed will keep rates at their current levels in June . After the meeting concludes on Wednesday, Fed Chair Jerome Powellwill provide more insight into the central bank’s view on the economy and interest rates .  Tesla could soon roll out its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, as soon as Sunday, June 22 . CEO Elon Musk said in a recent social media post that the company could roll out the service . The introduction of the service could be a key moment for Tesla .  Lennar’s (LEN) expected report after the bell on Monday follows the homebuilder's warning of weakness in the housing market in the prior quarter . Friday reports from Accenture(ACN) and CarMax(KMX) will be posted in the shadow of both companies' lower-than-expected profits .  Investopedia’s Sabrina Karl has advice for what new grads can do to set themselves up for the future . Read more about the four smart things grads should do with their gift money .

The S&P 500 returned 1,860% over the last three decades, or 10.4% annually . Warren Buffett has often advised investors to periodically buy and patiently hold . Buffett has earned a reputation as one of Wall Street's greatest investors .  TheS&P 500 measures the performance of 500 large and profitable U.S. companies that cover about 80% of domestic equities and 50% of global equities by market value . Warren Buffett, in his 1993 letter to shareholders, wrote, "By periodically investing in an index fund, for example, the know-nothing investor can actually outperform most investment professionals"  The Vanguard S&P 500 ETF has an expense ratio of 0.03%, meaning shareholders will pay $0.30 annually for every $1,000 invested in the fund . The index has returned 1,860% in the last 30 years, equivalent to 10.4% annually .  $400 contributed monthly to the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF would be worth $77,900 in one decade, $287,700 in two decades, and $851,800 in three decades . The current share price is $549, but investors can expect similar returns in the next 30 years .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is 988% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . The "Magnificent Seven" isn’t an official index, but Netflix deserves to be included over the EV maker . Tesla has been a huge winner for investors over the long haul, but the business is dealing with notable issues these days .  Tesla's automotive revenue declined 20% year over year in Q1 . In 2024, it reported its first-ever year-over-year drop in deliveries . Higher interest rates and a more competitive environment have put downward pressure on demand for its vehicles .  Netflix added 41 million net new customers in 2024, bringing its total to nearly 302 million at year's end . While Tesla faces a battle to get itself back on track, Netflix continues to flourish .  Netflix commands 7.5% of video viewing time in the U.S. in April . The streaming industry, like the automotive market, is extremely competitive . Netflix has a massive subscriber base, and trailing 12-month revenue of $40 billion .  Netflix continues to make the case that it deserves to be mentioned with the tech giants in that group . Given the streaming pioneer's ongoing success, it belongs in that exclusive club instead of Tesla .  Netflix has outperformed the S&P 500 in recent years compared to172% for the S-P 500 . Tesla's performance is compared to Netflix's 172% outperformance compared to 172% for S-500 .

The "Magnificent Seven" produced far better earnings growth than the rest of the market in the first quarter . Amazon and Alphabet were the biggest contributors to the outperformance . The index is up nearly 70% since Oct. 2022 .  FactSet reported the Magnificent Seven grew earnings 27.7% in aggregate . That massively outperformed analysts' expectations of 16.0% earnings growth for the group . Six out of the seven outperformed expectations, and five of them grew earnings faster than the other 493 companies in the S&P 500 .  Tesla has suffered from political backlash against CEO Elon Musk, combined with rising competition from Chinese automakerBYD . Amazon Web Services grew sales 17% year over year, while its margin expanded to 39.5% . Google Cloud grew sales 28% with its operating margin expanding to 17.8% .  Analysts expect the Magnificent Seven to continue beating the rest of the market in terms of earnings growth through the end of 2025 . Tesla is the only one showing weakness at the moment, but the group's outperformance isn't going to last forever . Analysts currently forecast first-quarter 2026 earnings growth of 10.2% for the group .  Investors will need to be more discriminating among the seven stocks going forward . Alphabet is currently the only member of the group with a forward price-to-earnings ratio below 25 . Analysts expect growth for the group to continue trailing the Magnificent Seven through the end of the year .  As the tide turns and we start to see more parity in the market, investors should expect a stronger showing over the next year (or longer) from smaller names in the stock market . Many of the Magnificent Seven are starting to look expensive relative to their future earnings growth prospects as analysts' expectations come down .
